tool.name: FeatureLinkerUnlabeledKD
tool.description: Groups corresponding features from multiple maps
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in_cond.in && #if $in_cond.in_select == "no" mkdir ${' '.join(["'in_cond.in/%s'" % (i) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} && ${' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in_cond.in/%s/%s.%s' && " % (f, i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(f.ext)) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} #else ln -s '$in_cond.in' 'in_cond.in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_cond.in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_cond.in.ext)' && #end if mkdir out && #if $design: mkdir design && ln -s '$design' 'design/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $design.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($design.ext)' && #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in #if $in_cond.in_select == "no" ${' '.join(["'in_cond.in/%s/%s.%s'"%(i, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', f.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(f.ext)) for i, f in enumerate($in_cond.in) if f])} #else 'in_cond.in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_cond.in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_cond.in.ext)' #end if -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("consensusxml")}' #if $design: -design 'design/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $design.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($design.ext)' #end if
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("consensusxml")}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in_select
param.label: Run tool in batch mode for -in
param.option: Yes: process each dataset in an independent job

param.label: input files separated by blanks
input files separated by blanks
input file containing the experimental design
For consensusXML input only: If set, the sub-features of the inputs are transferred to the output

param.name: mz_unit
param.label: Unit of m/z tolerance

param.name: nr_partitions
param.label: Number of partitions in m/z space

param.name: enabled
param.label: Whether or not to internally warp feature RTs using LOWESS transformation before linking (reported RTs in results will always be the original RTs)

param.name: rt_tol
param.label: Width of RT tolerance window (sec)

param.name: mz_tol
param.label: m/z tolerance (in ppm or Da)

param.name: max_pairwise_log_fc
param.label: Maximum absolute log10 fold change between two compatible signals during compatibility graph construction
param.help: Two signals from different maps will not be connected by an edge in the compatibility graph if absolute log fold change exceeds this limit (they might still end up in the same connected component, however). Note: this does not limit fold changes in the linking stage, only during RT alignment, where we try to find high-quality alignment anchor points. Setting this to a value < 0 disables the FC check

param.name: min_rel_cc_size
param.label: Only connected components containing compatible features from at least max(2, (warp_min_occur * number_of_input_maps)) input maps are considered for computing the warping function

param.name: max_nr_conflicts
param.label: Allow up to this many conflicts (features from the same map) per connected component to be used for alignment (-1 means allow any number of conflicts)

param.name: rt_tol
param.label: Width of RT tolerance window (sec)

param.name: mz_tol
param.label: m/z tolerance (in ppm or Da)

param.name: charge_merging
param.label: whether to disallow charge mismatches (Identical), allow to link charge zero
param.help: (i.e., unknown charge state) with every charge state, or disregard charges (Any)

param.name: adduct_merging
param.label: whether to only allow the same adduct for linking (Identical), also allow linking features with adduct-free ones, or disregard adducts (Any)

section.name: distance_RT
section.title: Distance component based on RT differences

param.name: exponent
param.label: Normalized RT differences ([0-1], relative to 'max_difference') are raised to this power (using 1 or 2 will be fast, everything else is REALLY slow)

param.name: weight
param.label: Final RT distances are weighted by this facto

section.name: distance_MZ
section.title: Distance component based on m/z differences

param.name: exponent
param.label: Normalized ([0-1], relative to 'max_difference') m/z differences are raised to this power (using 1 or 2 will be fast, everything else is REALLY slow)

param.name: weight
param.label: Final m/z distances are weighted by this facto

section.name: distance_intensity
section.title: Distance component based on differences in relative intensity (usually relative to highest peak in the whole data set)

param.name: exponent
param.label: Differences in relative intensity ([0-1]) are raised to this power (using 1 or 2 will be fast, everything else is REALLY slow)

param.name: weight
param.label: Final intensity distances are weighted by this facto

param.name: log_transform
param.label: Log-transform intensities
param.help: If disabled, d = |int_f2 - int_f1| / int_max. If enabled, d = |log(int_f2 + 1) - log(int_f1 + 1)| / log(int_max + 1))

section.name: LOWESS
section.title: LOWESS parameters for internal RT transformations (only relevant if 'warp:enabled' is set to 'true')

param.name: span
param.label: Fraction of datapoints (f) to use for each local regression (determines the amount of smoothing)
param.help: Choosing this parameter in the range .2 to .8 usually results in a good fit

param.name: num_iterations
param.label: Number of robustifying iterations for lowess fitting

param.name: delta
param.label: Nonnegative parameter which may be used to save computations (recommended value is 0.01 of the range of the input
param.help: e.g. for data ranging from 1000 seconds to 2000 seconds, it could be set to 10). Setting a negative value will automatically do this

param.name: interpolation_type
param.label: Method to use for interpolation between datapoints computed by lowess
param.help: 'linear': Linear interpolation. 'cspline': Use the cubic spline for interpolation. 'akima': Use an akima spline for interpolation

param.name: extrapolation_type
param.label: Method to use for extrapolation outside the data range
param.help: 'two-point-linear': Uses a line through the first and last point to extrapolate. 'four-point-linear': Uses a line through the first and second point to extrapolate in front and and a line through the last and second-to-last point in the end. 'global-linear': Uses a linear regression to fit a line through all data points and use it for interpolation

param.label: Overrides tool-specific checks
Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Groups corresponding features from multiple maps.
